definition: SWAT (Special Weapons And Tactics)/riot police/abbr. for 特種警察|特种警察[te4 zhong3 jing3 cha2]
special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex

sentences.english: Court packed with 80 reporters and 25 federal special police.
sentences.chinese: 庭上擠滿80名記者及25名聯邦特警。

sentences.english: The SWAT officers at the school failed to provide Glover with any medical assistance.
sentences.chinese: 學校的特警們並沒有給格羅佛任何醫療幫助。

sentences.english: Eighteen SWAT police teams from all over Chinatook part in the drill on Thursday.
sentences.chinese: 來自各個地區的18支特警隊參加了此次演習。

sentences.english: Edison Chan with the Hongkong film" Gen-X cops II" makes Hongkong person know.
sentences.chinese: 陳冠希與香港電影《特警新人類”讓香港人知道。

sentences.english: Many departments also maintain two or more SWAT teams that rotate on-call.
sentences.chinese: 許多警察局還維持兩個或更多的特警隊，輪流待命。

sentences.english: Instead, a local Manila police Swat team was used.
sentences.chinese: 相反，馬尼拉當地的一支特警隊被投入救援行動。

sentences.english: But Sergeant Canty says the technology can have its drawbacks.
sentences.chinese: 但是，特警隊隊長康蒂說，高技術也有缺點。

sentences.english: She gave him a swat on the head.
sentences.chinese: 他說，縣是想放在一起一特警隊的時間。

definition: abbr. for 刑事警察[xing2 shi4 jing3 cha2]/criminal police
special duty (e.g. extra security or traffic control on special occasions)/person on special duty
